DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: FREITAS, Andre Lage;FREITAS, A. L.;Freitas, André Lage;LAGE-FREITAS, André;LAGE-FREITAS, ANDRE

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Professor Adjunto da Universidade Federal de Alagoas (UFAL) com doutorado em Informática pelo Institut National Des Sciences Appliquées de Rennes (França). Seus interesses de pesquisa estão focados em Sistemas Distribuídos, principalmente em gestão de recursos da computação em nuvem (Cloud), ciência dos dados (Data Science, Big Data) com foco em dados de sensoriamento remoto. Tem experiência em projetos internacionais financiados pela Microsoft Azure Research, União Européia (FP7 e H2020) e pela América Latina (CONICYT - Chile). Exerceu o cargo de Coordenador de Pesquisa da Pró-Reitoria de Pesquisa e Pós-Graduação (Propep) da UFAL e atualmente exerce o cargo de Assessor de Pós-Graduação da Propep. É avaliador ad'hoc da Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo (FAPESP) e revisor do periódico IEEE Geoscience and Remote Sensing Letters. É membro do Laboratório de Computação Científica e Análise Numérica (LaCCAN). É associado à Sociedade Brasileira de Computação (SBC) e ao Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE), do qual é Conselheiro do Ramo Estudantil IEEE-UFAL.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Dr. André Lage-Freitas is an Assistant Professor of Universidade Federal de Alagoas (UFAL) and member of LaCCAN lab (Laboratório de Computação Científica e Análise Numérica). He also holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the Institut National des Sciences Appliquées de Rennes (INRIA, France), a Master Degree in computer Science from the Universitée de Rennes 1 (France) and a Bachelor Degree in Computer Science from the Universidade Federal da Bahia (Brazil). The main research problem he is working on is how to ease the use of Cloud computing infrastructures for Data Science applications by focusing on big remote sensing data sets. Dr. André Lage-Freitas has experience in international research projects such as CloudArray project (coordinator) funded by Microsoft Azure Research and further international projects funded by European Union and Latin America, e.g., EOxposure H2020, S-CUBE FP7, CONICYT (Chile), and FAPEAL (Brazil). He reviews research projects for FAPESP (São Paulo Research Foundation) and he is a reviewer of the IEEE Geoscience and Remote Sensing Letters journal. He held for two years the Research Coordinator position and he currently holds the Vice-Coordinator of Graduate Course position under the UFAL Vice-Presidency of Research and Graduate Course. He is an IEEE member and is Counsellor of IEEE-UFAL Student Branch.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CloudArray: highly-responsive machine learning in the cloud - Microsoft Azure Research Award Program 2015-2016
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Current cloud programming support for highly-responsive machine learning applications are either complex to use or provide limited features. This research project aims at developing the CloudArray support for highly-responsive machine learning applications. CloudArray provides high-level cloud programming support which transparently deals with resource management based on service-level objectives. Expected results include (i) open-source and standard cloud programming support for building highly-responsive machine learning applications; (ii) two Azure-based open-source applications able to solve real-world problems; (iii) further contributions to the open-source community such as training material and pull requests.
Web page: https://github.com/gsd-ufal/CloudArray.jl
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Current cloud programming support for highly-responsive machine learning applications are either complex to use or provide limited features. This research project aims at developing the CloudArray support for highly-responsive machine learning applications. CloudArray provides high-level cloud programming support which transparently deals with resource management based on service-level objectives. Expected results include (i) open-source and standard cloud programming support for building highly-responsive machine learning applications; (ii) two Azure-based open-source applications able to solve real-world problems; (iii) further contributions to the open-source community such as training material and pull requests.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Detecção de eventos sociais a partir de dados de fontes heterogêneas no contexto de cidades inteligentes
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Fapeal Edital 14/2016, Processo 60030 001261/2017 - Este projeto tem como objetivo avançar o estado da arte para os serviços baseados em dados de sensoriamento social na área de computação ubíqua aplicada ao contexto de cidades inteligentes. Propõe-se realizar análise de dados coletados através de sensoriamento social com o intuito de detectar e analisar o impacto de eventos sociais. A análise de eventos sociais é relevante no contexto de cidades inteligentes pois os eventos geram impactos em diversos aspectos em uma cidade. As cidades podem utilizar os resultados dos estudos propostos nesse projeto para melhorar seus gerenciamentos, e planejamento, bem como melhorar o entendimento da mobilidade dos cidadãos, e assim, promover serviços públicos de maior qualidade. Adicionalmente, propõe-se investigar técnicas de análise de grandes volumes de dados (big data) para lidar com a crescente quantidade de dados gerados pelas cidades inteligentes

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: EOxposure - Tools for Mapping Human Exposure to Risky Environmental Conditions by Means of Ground and Earth Observation Data
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: information layers from current and future Earth Observation (EO) missions, as well as the growing sensor web on the ground. The project exploits the novel concept of the human EXPOSOME, i.e. the set of exposures to which an individual is subjected through its own existence. It includes the entire history of interactions with the environment, including air and water quality, food and exercises, as well as living habits and diseases that may spread. The cutting-edge fusion of this concept with EO and sensor data aims at measuring the human exposure to threats that are external to each individual, and quantify the interactions between human beings and the environment. By building geospatial information tools upon data coming from multiple sources, at different spatial and temporal scales, the EOxposure project aims at providing free public services, enabling citizens to understand the threats to which they are exposed, and decision makers to take more informed and effective actions against them. Specifically, EOxposure will focus on threats connected to housing conditions, disease spread, as well as security and health issues in urban and peri-urban areas, where population is concentrated. The new tools will build upon the consortium expertize on nutrition- and vector-borne disease models, urban heat monitoring and material characterization, satellite data processing, and geospatial data fusion, realizing interdisciplinary working groups dedicated to the above mentioned applications. To do so, EOxposure enrolls institutions from Europe and South America, merging expertises on exposure to risk in both developed and developing countries.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: EOxposure - Tools for Mapping Human Exposure to Risky Environmental Conditions by Means of Ground and Earth Observation Data (H2020 Project)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: HIPaaS: Huge Image Processing-as-a-Service - Uma plataforma de computação em nuvem para o processamento de imagens muito grandes
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Fapeal Edital 4/2016, Processo 60030 1080/2016 - A crescente demanda de armazenamento de dados de imagens digitais a ngiu o ordem de grandeza de terabytes. Aplicações que envolvem grande quan dade de dados de imagens requerem a u lização de infraestruturas distribuídas para aumentar a capacidade de armazenamento e processar os dados paralelamente. No contexto dessas aplicações, destaca-se o processamento de imagens de sensoriamento remoto que têm u lizado a computação em nuvem como infraestrutura de execução. Os serviços ofertados pela computação em nuvem u lizam tecnologias de virtualização para gerir automa camente as infraestruturas sicas de processamento e de rede. Entretanto, as interfaces de programação disponibilizadas pela computação em nuvem não são de fácil u lização para os desenvolvedores de aplicações que envolvem grande quan dade de imagens. Esse projeto tem como obje vo prover abstrações e operações de programação que facilitem o processamento de grande quan dade de dados de imagens u lizando a computação em nuvem como infraestrutura de execução. A metodologia empregada consiste em formalizar as soluções em algoritmos e validá-las em protó pos de pesquisa.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: HIPaaS: Huge Image Processing-as-a-Service - Uma plataforma de computação em nuvem para o processamento de imagens muito grandes

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Adaptative Distributed Machine Learning: Learning from Heterogeneous Data Sources under Non-stationary Environment
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The development of technologies for high throughput data acquisition in a number of domains (e.g. biological sciences, environmental sciences, astronomy, meteorological sciences, etc.), together with advances in digital storage, computing, and communications technologies have resulted in unprecedented opportunities for scientist to use the wealth of distributed information available in learning, scientific discovery, and decision making. Classic Data Mining/Machine Learning architectures do not fulfill such needs, due to high communication, storage and computing costs (among other problems). Due to the huge amount of data distributed in different sources, it is infeasible to collect all this information and store them in a centralized data source. That is why it is necessary to propose novel approaches for classic Machine Learning algorithms to work in Distributed Environments. We call this Adaptive Distributed Machine Learning. There have been many advances in the supervised learning task for horizontally and vertically fragmented scenarios in the last years (separately), but the problem of Distributed Machine Learning with hybrid data fragmentation (both scenarios at the same time) has not been fully addressed. Also the problem where batches of data examples arrive over time, has not been considered in the state of the art of the Distributed Machine Learning community. In non-stationary environments, these batches of data may suffer from concept drift, meaning that the underlying law of probability that generates the data may change over time. Also, if we add the inherent complexity of handling very large data sets that are distributed, the full task becomes very challenging. This project deals with Distributed Learning problems, with different underlying laws of probability governing the distributed sources, in incremental scenarios, minimizing the communication, storage and processing costs.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Adaptative Distributed Machine Learning: Learning from Heterogeneous Data Sources under Non-stationary Environment

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-SOFTWARE.TITULO-DO-SOFTWARE: Qu4DS - Quality Assurance for Distributed Services
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-SOFTWARE.TITULO-DO-SOFTWARE-INGLES: Qu4DS - Quality Assurance for Distributed Services

DETALHAMENTO-DO-SOFTWARE.FINALIDADE: Validar pesquisa no âmbito da gestão da execução de serviços em ambientes distribuídos.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Qu4DS (Quality Assurance for Distributed Services) is a research prototype framework which autonomously manages services on top of distributed infrastructures.
The framework provides PaaS (Platform-as-a-Service) support that fills the gap between the higher-level SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) and the underlying IaaS (Infrastructure-as-a-Service). Qu4DS also aids service administrators to define high-level objectives that guide execution management in an automatic and transparent fashion.
Moreover, Qu4DS addresses the SLA life-cycle while increasing the service provider profit. SLA life-cycle is handled through service negotiation, instantiation and management on the infrastructure. Orthogonally to these features, complementary actions are in charge of increasing the provider profit guided by SLA constraints.
More information at: http://www.irisa.fr/myriads/software/quads/
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Qu4DS (Quality Assurance for Distributed Services) is a research prototype framework which autonomously manages services on top of distributed infrastructures.
The framework provides PaaS (Platform-as-a-Service) support that fills the gap between the higher-level SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) and the underlying IaaS (Infrastructure-as-a-Service). Qu4DS also aids service administrators to define high-level objectives that guide execution management in an automatic and transparent fashion.
Moreover, Qu4DS addresses the SLA life-cycle while increasing the service provider profit. SLA life-cycle is handled through service negotiation, instantiation and management on the infrastructure. Orthogonally to these features, complementary actions are in charge of increasing the provider profit guided by SLA constraints.
More information at: http://www.irisa.fr/myriads/software/quads/

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-SOFTWARE.TITULO-DO-SOFTWARE: CloudArray - Easy big data programming in the cloud

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
CloudArray is a programming abstraction that eases big data programming in the cloud. CloudArray loads data from files then books and configures the right amount of resources (VMs, containers) able to process it. Data loading and resource management are entirely automatic and performed on-demand.
CloudArray builds on top of Julia native DistributedArrays abstraction, a multi-dimensional array whose data is transparently stored at distributed computers. Indeed, a CloudArray is a DistributedArray whose data and resource managements are automatic as the figure bellow illustrates: data load, VM booking, Julia workers configuration on top of Docker containers.
https://github.com/gsd-ufal/CloudArray.jl
